Label: Innovation Name
Definition: Primary name for the innovation as reported by the source used in the horizon scan.

Label: Dosage
Definition: Dosage information for the innovation, including strength, frequency, and duration where applicable.
Choices/Unit: As reported (e.g., mg, mg/kg, IU, mL, frequency)

Label: Delivery Form
Definition: Physical or clinical form in which the innovation is delivered or administered.
Choices/Unit: Tablet; Capsule; Injection; Infusion; Patch; Device; Software; Assay; Other

Label: Alternative Names
Definition: Other names used for the same innovation (generic name, brand names, synonyms, registry names, database aliases).

Label: Innovation Category
Definition: High-level category of the innovation, used to drive downstream fields like technology and readiness requirements.

Label: Technology
Definition: Technology classification within the innovation category (more specific than category). Should be a controlled vocabulary to support filtering and comparison.
Choices/Unit: Diagnostics: RDT, molecular (PCR/NAAT), antigen, antibody/serology, culture, imaging, biosensor, multiplex panel, AI/algorithmic. Therapeutics: small molecule, biologic/monoclonal, gene therapy, cell therapy, drug-device combination, long-acting formulation, repurposed drug. Vaccines: mRNA, viral vector, protein subunit, conjugate, live attenuated, inactivated, DNA, nanoparticle. Devices: implantable, wearable, point-of-care device, digital health, decision support, specimen collection, cold-chain/logistics.

Label: Disease
Definition: Disease domain targeted by the innovation (primary classification for the scan).

Label: Indication
Definition: Specific clinical indication and use-case (what condition, stage, population, setting, and intent). Example: “uncomplicated falciparum malaria treatment”, “TB preventive therapy”, “PPH prevention”, “pediatric HIV viral load monitoring”.
Choices/Unit: Free text: condition + intent + population + setting

Label: Archetype
Definition: Maturity archetype aligned to Young et al definitions, used as a simplified development stage label.

Label: Data Scope
Definition: Marker to indicate the scope the data comes from (e.g. Global, Kenya, South Africa, Senegal).

Label: Phase 1 Trial Status
Definition: Phase 1 trial status

Label: Phase 1 Trial Status Date
Definition: Date the trial status was achieved (e.g. trial completion) or last verified or updated (from registry update date, publication date, or extraction date).

Label: Phase 2 Trial Status
Definition: Phase 2 trial status

Label: Phase 2 Trial Status Date
Definition: Date the trial status was achieved (e.g. trial completion) or last verified or updated (from registry update date, publication date, or extraction date).

Label: Phase 3 Trial Status
Definition: Phase 3 trial status

Label: Phase 3 Trial Status Date
Definition: Date the trial status was achieved (e.g. trial completion) or last verified or updated (from registry update date, publication date, or extraction date).

Label: Phase 4 Trial Status
Definition: Phase 4 trial status

Label: Phase 4 Trial Status Date
Definition: Date the trial status was achieved (e.g. trial completion) or last verified or updated (from registry update date, publication date, or extraction date).

Label: Clinical Trial Status
Definition: Most advanced known clinical trial development status (or best available evidence stage) at the time of extraction.
Choices/Unit: Preclinical; Phase 1; Phase 2; Phase 3; Phase 4; Observational; Implementation/Pilot; Not in trials; Unknown

Label: Date Trial Status
Definition: Date the trial status was last verified or updated (from registry update date, publication date, or extraction date).

Label: National Regulatory Approval (NRA) – South Africa
Definition: Whether the innovation has approval/authorization by the South African Health Products Regulatory Authority (SAHPRA) for the setting being evaluated.

Label: NRA Date – South Africa
Definition: Date of NRA approval/authorization in South Africa (if known).

Label: National Regulatory Approval (NRA) – Kenya
Definition: Whether the innovation has approval/authorization by the Pharmacy and Poisons Board (PPB) of Kenya for the setting being evaluated.

Label: NRA Date – Kenya
Definition: Date of NRA approval/authorization in Kenya (if known).

Label: National Regulatory Approval (NRA) – Senegal
Definition: Whether the innovation has approval/authorization by the Direction de la Pharmacie et du Médicament (DPM) of Senegal for the setting being evaluated.

Label: NRA Date – Senegal
Definition: Date of NRA approval/authorization in Senegal (if known).

Label: Other National Regulatory Agency that approved the innovation
Definition: Other National Regulatory Agency that approved the innovation

Label: NRA Date Other
Definition: Date of other NRA approval/authorization (if known).

Label: Global Regulatory Approval (GRA)
Definition: Whether the innovation has approval/authorization/prequalification by a global body.

Label: GRA Date
Definition: Date of global approval/prequalification (if known).

Label: GRA Body
Definition: Global body granting approval or listing (for example: WHO PQ, FDA, EMA, Global Fund listing where applicable).

Label: GRA Note
Definition: Notes supporting GRA fields (type of approval, scope, link/reference, ambiguity).

Label: In Essential Medicine List (WHO)
Definition: Whether the innovation is listed on WHO Essential Medicines List.

Label: EML Date (WHO)
Definition: Date of EML publication or date the innovation was included (if available).

Label: In Essential Medicine List (Kenya)
Definition: Whether the innovation is listed on Kenya Essential Medicines List.

Label: EML Date (Kenya)
Definition: Date of EML publication or date the innovation was included (if available).

Label: In Essential Medicine List (SA)
Definition: Whether the innovation is listed on South Africa Essential Medicines List.

Label: EML Date (SA)
Definition: Date of EML publication or date the innovation was included (if available).

Label: In Essential Medicine List (Senegal)
Definition: Whether the innovation is listed on Senegal Essential Medicines List.

Label: EML Date (Senegal)
Definition: Date of EML publication or date the innovation was included (if available).

Label: Probability of Success
Definition: Probability of success based on the method by Terry RF, Yamey G, Miyazaki-Krause R et al. Funding global health product R&D: the Portfolio-To-Impact Model (P2I), a new tool for modelling the impact of different research portfolios [version 2; peer review: 2 approved]

Label: Procurement Model
Definition: Likely procurement mechanism in-country (how it would be bought and by whom).
Choices/Unit: Government tender; Donor-funded; Pooled procurement; Private sector; Mixed; Unknown

Label: Regulatory Approval
Definition: Summary regulatory readiness derived from EML, NRA, and GRA status (a synthesized field for scoring).
Choices/Unit: None; NRA only; GRA only; NRA+GRA; EML listed; Unknown

Label: Policy Readiness
Definition: Degree to which policies and strategies support adoption (WHO-level for global or national strategies including reimbursement, prioritization).

Label: Social Context
Definition: Contextual fit, acceptability, equity implications, and likely adoption barriers related to the innovation and setting.
Choices/Unit: Low barrier; Moderate barrier; High barrier; Unknown

Label: Guidelines and Training
Definition: Likely procurement mechanism in-country (how it would be bought and by whom).
Choices/Unit: Not available; In development; Available (limited); Available (widely); Unknown

Label: Policy Implemented
Definition: Whether relevant policies are actively implemented, including programmatic coverage.

Label: Date to Reach Market
Definition: Expected date of market entry or availability for procurement in the target setting - based on the method by "Mao, Wenhui et al. Development, launch, and scale-up of health products in low-income and middle-income countries: a retrospective analysis on 59 health products. The Lancet Global Health, Volume 13, Issue 6, e1132 - e1139"

Label: In Country Supply
Definition: Whether there is local manufacturing, packaging, assembly, or reliable in-country supply channels.

Label: Distribution
Definition: Expected distribution channel and constraints (cold chain, last-mile, facility level, community delivery).
Choices/Unit: Central medical stores; Facility-based; Community-based; Private pharmacies; Hybrid; Unknown

Label: Delivery Model
Definition: How the innovation is delivered clinically or programmatically (who delivers it, where, and workflow).
Choices/Unit: Facility outpatient; Inpatient; Community health worker; Outreach campaigns; Self-administered; Digital/remote; Hybrid

Label: Efficacy
Definition: Best available efficacy/effectiveness estimate (and context), ideally quantitative but can be summarized when early-stage.
Ranges: If numeric: 0 to 1 (or 0 to 100 if percent)

Label: Disability-Adjusted Life Years (DALYs)
Definition: Baseline DALYs for the disease and geography relevant to the scan.

Label: Disease Prevalence
Definition: Baseline prevalence for the disease and target setting, aligned to the analysis approach.

Label: Improvement
Definition: Mechanism of benefit relative to standard of care (what improves and how). Example: higher sensitivity, fewer stockouts, shorter time-to-treatment, reduced adverse events.
Choices/Unit: Free text; optionally map to controlled terms later

Label: DALYs Averted
Definition: Estimated DALYs averted attributable to adoption of the innovation under stated assumptions.

Label: Deaths Averted
Definition: Estimated deaths averted attributable to adoption of the innovation under stated assumptions.

Label: Years of Life Lost (YLL)
Definition: Estimated years of life lost averted due to the innovation (subset of DALYs or separate component depending on approach).

Label: Health Systems Costs
Definition: R&D estimates according to Terry RF, Gardner CA, Dieleman JL, et al. *Funding global health product R&D: the Portfolio-to-Impact (P2I) model.* Health Policy Plan. 2018.

Label: Monetized DALYs
Definition: Monetized value of DALYs averted

Label: Time to Regulatory Approval
Definition: Estimated time from proof of concept to first regulatory approval, based on the development stage-specific method by "Mao, Wenhui et al. Development, launch, and scale-up of health products in low-income and middle-income countries: a retrospective analysis on 59 health products. The Lancet Global Health, Volume 13, Issue 6, e1132 - e1139"

Label: Time from Approval to First Launch
Definition: Estimated time between regulatory approval and first country launch based on the method by "Mao, Wenhui et al. Development, launch, and scale-up of health products in low-income and middle-income countries: a retrospective analysis on 59 health products. The Lancet Global Health, Volume 13, Issue 6, e1132 - e1139"

Label: Time from Launch to 20% LMIC Uptake
Definition: Estimated time from first country launch to achieving 20% uptake in at least one LMIC based on the method by "Mao, Wenhui et al. Development, launch, and scale-up of health products in low-income and middle-income countries: a retrospective analysis on 59 health products. The Lancet Global Health, Volume 13, Issue 6, e1132 - e1139"

Label: Expected Regulatory Approval Date
Definition: Expected date of first regulatory approval, calculated from trial completion date and estimated development time based on the method by "Mao, Wenhui et al. Development, launch, and scale-up of health products in low-income and middle-income countries: a retrospective analysis on 59 health products. The Lancet Global Health, Volume 13, Issue 6, e1132 - e1139"

Label: Expected First Launch Date
Definition: Expected date of first country-level launch, calculated from expected regulatory approval date based on the method by "Mao, Wenhui et al. Development, launch, and scale-up of health products in low-income and middle-income countries: a retrospective analysis on 59 health products. The Lancet Global Health, Volume 13, Issue 6, e1132 - e1139"

Label: Expected 20% Market Uptake Date
Definition: Expected date when the innovation reaches 20% uptake in an LMIC based on the method by "Mao, Wenhui et al. Development, launch, and scale-up of health products in low-income and middle-income countries: a retrospective analysis on 59 health products. The Lancet Global Health, Volume 13, Issue 6, e1132 - e1139"

Label: Overall Readiness Score
Definition: Composite readiness score summarizing regulatory, policy, financing, and delivery preparedness.

Label: Financing Readiness
Definition: Financing readiness score derived from probability of success and procurement model availability.
